tasks.question_text: These days (0) _______________ people can type faster than they can write by hand...

tasks.question_text: ...particularly (10) _______________ they've grown up using laptops.
options: A) that
B) if
C) then
D) how
tasks.explanation: The clause introduces a condition or assumption: 'particularly if they've grown up using laptops'.

tasks.question_text: ...useful skill and allows you to take notes quickly and easily, (11) _______________ must certainly be a good thing.
options: A) which
B) it
C) what
D) that
tasks.explanation: 'Which' introduces a non-defining relative clause, referring back to the previous statement about the skill being useful for taking notes quickly and easily.

tasks.question_text: ...by hand had no (12) _______________ to concentrate on the information to allow them to summarise.
options: A) more chance
B) difficulty in
C) possibility
D) choice but
tasks.explanation: The idiom 'had no choice but to concentrate' implies that the slower speed of writing forced them to process information more deeply, fitting the context 'no X to concentrate...'.

tasks.question_text: but when (13) _______________ asked to explain the concepts covered in the lecture...
options: A) it was
B) the teacher
D) all of them
tasks.explanation: In English, a reduced clause (participial clause) like 'When asked to explain...' often omits the subject ('they were asked'), so a dash indicates no additional word is needed, representing this implicit construction.

tasks.question_text: When the students (14) _______________ allowed to revise from their notes before being tested a week later...
options: A) had
B) were
C) would be
D) have been
tasks.explanation: This forms a passive construction: 'the students were allowed to revise'.

tasks.question_text: The reason (15) _______________ when using a pen and paper, you process the information more deeply...
options: A) why is
B) for that
C) is that
D) for which
tasks.explanation: The phrase 'The reason is that...' is a standard way to introduce an explanation.

tasks.question_text: ...you process the information more deeply (16) _______________ you can't possibly write it all down.
options: A) while
B) because
C) however,
D) in case
tasks.explanation: 'Because' introduces the reason for processing information more deeply: the inability to write everything down.
